heading: passage: daisy bates, 84
subheading: as head of the arkansas naacp in 1957, bates played a key role in integrating little rock's central high school, counseling the black students who would become known as the little rock nine. for her efforts, two crosses were burned on her front lawn and she was the target of numerous death threats. bates, along with her husband lucius bates, ran the arkansas state press, a newspaper that championed civil rights, between 1941 and 1959.
author: wired staff
